data.text:
Kroonstad at a glance

Background and Historical Information of the Area

Kroonstad was originally founded in 1855 and briefly served as the capital of the then-Orange Free State. It is a busy agricultural and transportation hub. Kroonstad serves as the Northern educational focus of the Free State with vocational and trade schools. It is within 64 kilometres from the Free State goldfields and to the north you will find coal and diamond mines. It stands as the Northern Free State's second-largest hub for commerce and urban development, following Welkom.

Area Serenity

Kroonstad is mainly an agricultural town. With vast open grass fields and a wide variety of commercial farms that specialise both in livestock and crops. Bloemhoek dam is just east of the town and provides ample opportunity for boating, fishing and other water-based activities. The town is characterised by typical high-street shopping but it also provides access to commercial shopping malls and shopping centres.

Lifestyle

Kroonstad is a farming community and is therefore known for its hospitality. It also offers all of the benefits of small-town living while still providing ample employment opportunities and growth due to its economic power and ideal location as the gateway to the Free State. The area offers a wide variety of outdoors and adventure activities such as fishing and horse riding.

Attractions in the area:

Fishing: The willow-covered banks of the Vals River is a massive attraction for hundreds of anglers annually and there is a wide selection of camping, caravan and chalet resorts on the banks of the river.

Boskoppie Lion & Tiger Reserve: Interact with the wilds of Africa by joining one of the guided lion & tiger tours at the sanctuary. Grab this opportunity to get up close and personal with lions, Bengal tigers, jaguars, leopards and caracals.

Kroonstad Parkrun: For a fun-filled parkrun every Saturday at 8am.

Kroonpark Holiday resort: This resort offers a variety of water activities like an indoor heated swimming pool and an outdoor splash tube and outdoor swimming pools. A great activity for the kids.

Kroonstad micro theatre and show house: Fantastic events, plays, shows, poetry, singing and art await you at this micro entertainment hub. Get your dose of cultural enrichment while enjoying a snack or your favourite beverage.

Kroonstad Golf Course: Treat yourself to 18 holes at the golf course or enjoy something from their wide range of food and drinks at the restaurant while relaxing in the outdoors.

Best Suburbs in Kroonstad

Kroonstad offers a variety of suburbs, each with its own unique charm and characteristics. The choice of the "top" suburbs often depends on individual preferences, lifestyle, and priorities. Here are some of the popular suburbs in Kroonstad:

Panorama:

Panorama is a residential area in Kroonstad known for its family-friendly environment.

Suidrand:

It's a smaller neighbourhood and may appeal to those looking for a mix of residential properties.

Wilgenhof:

Wilgenhof could offer various housing options, and its location within Kroonstad may provide residents with convenient access to amenities.

Education

Primary and High Schools include Hoërskool Trio, Zenith High school, Voorwaarts Primary School, St Peter Claver High School, Kroonheuwel Primary School, and Brentpark Secondary School.

Safety

Like numerous other cities, it is imperative to implement safety measures to ensure the well-being of both you and your loved ones. Several secure residential estates are available as viable options for those seeking a secure and tranquil living environment.

Statistics

Let us look at the demographics of homeowners, sellers, and buyers by age in Kroonstad.

Sellers: 51% aged 18-35.

Buyers: 42% aged 36-49.

Owners: 49% aged 64+

Healthcare

Hospitals and clinics in the area include Kroonstad Health Complex, Hill Street Clinic, Netcare Kroon Hospital, Kroonstad Veterinary Clinic, National Renal Care Kroonstad, Brentpark Clinic, Relling JE Physiotherapy, and Mens Clinic International.

Shopping Centres

The options for shopping centres in Kroonstad are limited, but two shopping centres that might cater to all the resident's shopping needs are, Panorama Plaza and Maokeng Mall.

Restaurants

Whether you are looking for a quiet restaurant or a vibrant coffee shop, you will find what you are looking for in Kroonstad. A few great restaurants and cafés in the area include:

Stasie 6 Kroonstad Restaurant

Tennessee Spur Steak Ranch

Die Koffie-Winkel

Plumbago Restaurant & Coffee shop

Distance from key points

Kroonstad is approximately 185.1 km from Bloemfontein (BFN) Airport, making it the nearest airport to the city. It is about a 2 hour drive.
